Description:
Detects suspicious SSH / SSHD error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts

Author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Suspicious OpenSSH Daemon Error
Query: sourcetype='linux-sshd' eql select * from _source_ where (log like '%unexpected internal error%' or log like '%unknown or unsupported key type%' or log like '%invalid certificate signing key%' or log like '%invalid elliptic curve value%' or log like '%incorrect signature%' or log like '%error in libcrypto%' or log like '%unexpected bytes remain after decoding%' or log like '%fatal: buffer_get_string: bad string%' or log like '%local: crc32 compensation attack%' or log like '%bad client public dh value%' or log like '%corrupted mac on input%')
